lines.text: [last lines]

Reuben, I have to say it. Livin' with you has been an adventure any woman would relish for the rest o' time. I look at cha, with your burned out face and your big belly and your bear-like paws and your shining eye, and I have to say you're a credit to the whole male sex, and I'm proud to have ya for my friend.
I'll be damned if she didn't get the last word in again. Well...
Say, uh, there's one thing I would like to get straight.
Hmm.
We both know that the Lord brands lyin' a sin. You think He'll still smile on you after them whoppers you told in there?
And if thy words stray from the truth for the good of God's own, if thy intent be pure, thou shall not then be judged sinful.
Beautiful quotation. What book? What chapter?
I will confess, Reuben, it is of my own invention, I just made it up.
You ain't got the know how to use it.
[gatling gun]

[Eula Goodnight fires off a burst]
Ain't that the way it works, Hawk?
I do not fear a skunk. I simply do not care for its odor.
It's payday, boys, come and get it!

[Rooster is getting ready to take a swig of whiskey]
Reuben, have you ever seen an enlarged picture of a drunkard's liver?
Damnation! Even in her sleep.
[Hits head on bottom of wagon]
Ow!
[shouts]
Good night, Ms. Goodnight!

[Whispers]
Good night, Reuben.
Just to whom do you think you are talking, Mr. Marshall?
You is to whom I think I am talking, Ma'am.
It's true that you are larger than me... but only physically.
In this case, my dear lady, that is enough.
Do you mean to tell me that you are prepared to use brute force?
That is exactly what I mean.

[pause]
Oh.

[Eula has gone to a creek to wash up]
Watch yourself, sister! Everything in these woods'll either bite ya, stab ya or stick ya!
That shows you know more about the Lord and His Good Book than you know about men!
That's my good fortune. I know enough about men to steer clear of them.

[to judge]
You seem to forget, Judge. You hung up my guns today.

[walks away]
I am retired, relieved, and rejoicing.
You can't lock up a man's whiskey!
[first lines]
It's the law, Pecos! We want you for the robbery of the Katy Flyer, murder of the engineer. Now git your hands on top your heads...
[gunshots]
You bastard! You - bastard!

[the Gatling gun falls in the river]
The gun. The gun, Reuben! We've lost the gun!
Well, now, sister, just what the hell can I do about it?
Damn your murderin' hides! Meet your maker!
[starts shooting]

[his deputy is shot]
You bastard!
[proceeds to kill all]
You bastards!

[to judge]
I was proud to tell my deputy's wife that I shot his killers!
How old are you?
Shall we say it has already struck midnight?
Well, out in the territory, we prize a dead shot more'n we do a lady's charms.
Then I've come to the right place, haven't I? You mean the men in the West do not mind if their women outshoot and outsmart them?
If they're quiet about it. No, here we value a spirited woman almost as much as we do a spirited horse.

[to Eula Goodnight]
Being around you pleases me.

Ma'am, I don't know much about thoroughbreds - horses or women! Them that I did know, I never liked. They're too nervous and spooky; they scare me. But you're one high-bred filly that don't. 'Course, I don't know what you're talking about half the time!

[referring to her bible quotation]
I will confess, Reuben, it is of my own invention. I just made it up!
Hallelujah and jubilee, that is one quotation I will remember!
And will you remember us, too, Reuben?
Longer than I'll remember that quotation, Miss Eula.
I ain't had a drink since breakfast, and the only time I wear this coat's in your courtroom. Was always good enough when you needed what was in it!
You ain't very hospitable.

I ain't got an ounce of goodwill in me, and that's a fact. I hate everybody. I'm a cantankerous old man, and I know it. I like myself better'n anyone I ever met, that's how come I took this job - to be alone with me!
Do you know anything about rafts? There's rough water down river.
I can ride. Can't be much different.
sly and fickle. You gotta watch it every minute.
You a sailor?
I was once. Shanghai McCoy's my name. Been around the Horn, sailed the seven seas, seen everything, done everything, that's how I know people are rotten. I've seen 'em all.
You're wrong, old man. We're made in God's image, and goodness is in us. Even in you.
Amazing! I never took you for a Bible-thumper.
Hold it. She is what she is 'cause she wants to be. That's the way you take her. Like me.
You're wastin' your time preachin'. You too, Sister. I'm a ship that can't be salvaged.
You're shippin' out with a strange crew, captain.
I'll match their mettle against most.
I'm glad it's your ship, not mine. Women can no more keep their mouths shut than a yellow-tailed catfish.

[pats McCoy's stomach]
Got to agree with you there.

[as Rooster first arrives at the mission]
You're too late, lawman.
Too late to stop 'em, but not too late to hang 'em.
